alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 5:10PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...MIXED RAIN AND SNOW THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... Heavy precipitation continues through 3 AM, tapering off by mid-morning. Rain is falling across most of the lower elevations along the Kenai Peninsula, though Kenai and areas nearby continue to hang on to the colder temperatures producing snow on the ground. Snow will hang on along the Sterling Highway north of Clam Gulch and the Seward Highway north of Kenai Lake as well. The rain may mix with or change back over to snow by early Friday morning as the precipitation comes to an end. Up to 2 inches of snow are possible along the Sterling Highway north of Clam Gulch, with the 2 inch total most likely near Kenai where temperatures are starting the day in the upper 20s. Many areas may either see snow will melt on contact with the ground. 1 to 5 inches of accumulation are possible through Turnagain Pass and Portage Valley, with the higher amounts through the Pass. Strong southeasterly wind gusts are also likely across Portage Valley and Turnagain Pass today. However, with temperatures around freezing, blowing snow is not expected to be a concern.

area.areaDesc: Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound
